body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}


In this conversation, the agent's name is Austin Gonzales and the customer's name is Christine King.  The conversation is about Phat Hogs (a Motorcycle Dealership ) and is a conversation about typical situation.The customer is feeling {emotion}.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello, my name is Austin Gonzales and I'm with Phat Hogs Motorcycle Dealership. How can I assist you today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Hi, I'm Christine King. I'm looking to buy a new motorcycle.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: It's great to meet you, Christine! We have a fantastic selection of motorcycles available. Can I ask you a couple of questions to help find the best fit for you?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Awesome! First, could you please tell me your age?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I am twenty eight years old.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you for that. And could you also provide me with your zip code?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Of course, it's one two three four five.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Perfect! Now that I have your information, I can recommend some great options for you.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: You're very welcome, Christine! Thank you for your time today. If you have any more questions, feel free to reach out!
